verses.verse: After these things I saw another angel come down from heaven having great authority. The earth was lit up with his glory.

He shouted loudly with a deafening voice saying, "Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and become the dwelling place of devils, the prison cell for every unclean spirit, and cage for every unclean and detestable bird.

"All nations have drunk the wine of the wrath of her fornication, the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her, and the merchants of the earth have grown rich through the abundance of her unrestrained lust."
Then I heard another voice from heaven saying, "Come out of her, my people, so that you are not partakers of her sins and don't receive her plagues,
because her sins are piled up to heaven, and God has remembered her wicked ways.
"Give to her even as she has given to you, even double for her double, according to her actions. In the cup, which she has filled, pour into hers twice as much.
"She has glorified herself so much and lived in luxury; give her as much torment and sorrow, because she says in her heart, «I sit as queen, and not a widow. I will never know grief.»
"Because of this her plagues will come in one day---death, mourning, and famine. She will be utterly burned with fire, because the Lord God who judges her is powerful.
"The kings of the earth, who committed fornication and lived luxuriously with her, will wail and grieve for her when they see the smoke of her burning.
"They stand far away, because they are afraid of the torment. They say, «How horrible, how horrible! This great and mighty city Babylon. In just one hour your judgment has come.»
"The merchants of the earth will wail and grieve over her, because no one buys their merchandise any more.

"[Their] merchandise [is] gold, silver, precious stones, pearls, and fine linen, purple cloth, silk, scarlet cloth, and thya wood, all kinds of containers of ivory, precious wood, brass, iron, marble,
also cinnamon, incenses, perfumed oils, frankincense, wine, olive oil, the finest wheat flour, and animals, sheep, and horses, chariots, slaves, even people's souls.
"The fruits your soul lusted for have gone from you as well as everything dainty and gorgeous, and you will find them never again.
"The merchants of these things, who became rich by her, will stand far away through the fear of her torment, weeping, and wailing saying,
«How horrible, how horrible! That great city which was dressed in fine linen, purple, and scarlet clothe and decked out with gold, precious stones, and pearls.
«For in just one hour such great riches is come to nothing.» Every ship's captain, all the passengers, sailors, and whosoever made their living from the sea stood far away.
When they saw the smoke of her burning they cried out, "What can compare to this great city?"

They threw dust on their heads and kept on crying, weeping, and wailing, saying, "How horrible, how horrible! That great city in which all who had ships at sea were made rich from her wealth, for in one hour she has come to nothing."
Rejoice over her, heaven, holy apostles, and prophets, because God has avenged her for you.
A mighty angel picked up a stone the size of a huge millstone and threw it into the sea saying, "This is how that great city Babylon will be thrown down with violence and never be found again.

"The sound of harpers, musicians, flute players, and trumpeters will never ever be heard in you again. No craftsman of whatever craft will ever be found in you, or the sound of a millstone ever be found in you.

"The light of a candle will never ever shine in you, neither the voice of a bridegroom and bride ever be heard in you, because your merchants were the great men of the earth, and by your sorceries all nations were deceived.
"Also the blood of prophets and God's people was found in her as well as all who were violently killed on the earth."
